category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 23 (Restrictions on concurrent positions for officers and employees)
contents: Article 23 (Restrictions on Concurrent Positions for Executives and Employees) â‘  Executives (excluding non-executive directors; hereinafter the same shall apply in this Article) and employees shall not engage in business for profit other than their duties. However, executives may concurrently engage in non-profit work if they receive permission from the appointing authority or recommendation authority, and employees may concurrently engage in non-profit work if they receive permission from the chairman of the board. Refers to the relevant work., 1. Work in which commerce, industry, finance, or other for-profit business is clearly pursued for profit by independently managing a commercial business; 2. Director of a commercial, industrial, financial, or other private enterprise for profit; Becoming an unlimited liability partner, manager, promoter or other executive who carries out audit work; 3. Investing in another person's company related to his/her duties; 4. Continuing to engage in other work for the purpose of property gain. doing
